crop.name: Carrot
crop.description: Carrots are a root vegetable with a crisp texture and sweet flavor. They are rich in beta-carotene, which gives them their bright orange color.

crop.name: Potato
crop.description: Potatoes are a starchy, tuberous crop from the perennial nightshade Solanum tuberosum. They are a good source of carbohydrates, fiber, and vitamin C.

crop.name: Tomato
crop.description: Tomatoes are a juicy, red (although they can come in a variety of colors) fruit that are commonly used in salads, sauces, and soups. They are rich in vitamins and antioxidants.

crop.name: Onion
crop.description: Onions are a staple in many cuisines and are used to add flavor to a wide variety of dishes. They are rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.

crop.name: Corn
crop.description: Corn, also known as maize, is a cereal crop that is grown widely throughout the world. It is used as a source of food, feed, and fuel.

crop.name: Wheat
crop.description: Wheat is a cereal crop that is grown widely throughout the world. It is used as a source of food, feed, and fuel.

crop.name: Rice
crop.description: Rice is a cereal crop that is grown widely throughout the world. It is a staple food for a large portion of the world's population.

crop.name: Soybean
crop.description: Soybeans are a legume crop that is grown widely throughout the world. They are used as a source of food, feed, and fuel.

crop.name: Cotton
crop.description: Cotton is a fiber crop that is grown widely throughout the world. It is used to make a variety of textiles and fabrics.

crop.name: Coffee
crop.description: Coffee is a beverage crop that is grown in tropical and subtropical regions of the world. It is one of the most popular beverages in the world.

crop.name: Banana
crop.description: Bananas are a tropical fruit that are grown in many parts of the world. They are a good source of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
